name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide has a basic melting point of around 5°C due to the presence of a benzene ring. The trifluoromethyl group (CF3) can increase the melting point by approximately +30°C due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity. The methyl group (CH3) can also contribute to the melting point by approximately +10°C due to its increased molecular weight and potential hydrogen bonding. The trifluoromethyl group can also participate in dipole interactions, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C. The fluorine atoms can also increase the melting point due to their high electronegativity and ability to participate in dipole interactions, estimated at around +10°C each.
